title: Satellite operators make case for helping military track ground targets
summary: The U.S. Air Force and Space Force are exploring the development of a dedicated GMTI satellite constellation while considering the integration of commercial remote sensing satellites for ground target tracking. Industry executives, including representatives from Umbra, Maxar Intelligence, and ICEYE, discussed the potential of hybrid approaches combining military and commercial systems to enhance situational awareness and reduce costs.
why_it_matters: The discussion highlights the evolving role of commercial satellite operators in supporting military objectives, potentially opening new opportunities for collaboration between the Pentagon and private sector in space-based surveillance.
